Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that interacts with an Ollama API to generate responses using HTTP requests through the Guzzle HTTP client.

Class Description: The Ollama class is designed to communicate with an Ollama API endpoint to generate responses based on provided prompts. It handles the configuration of the API request and processes the response.

Attributes:
- model: string - The name of the AI model to be used for generating responses.
- prompt: string - The input text prompt to be sent to the AI model.
- temperature: float - Controls the randomness of the output (higher values make output more random).
- stream: bool - Determines whether the response should be streamed.
- raw: bool - Specifies whether to use raw mode for the prompt processing.

Methods:
- __construct(string $model, string $prompt, float $temperature, bool $stream, bool $raw) -> void - Initializes the Ollama instance with the specified parameters for model interaction.
- ask() -> string - Sends a POST request to the Ollama API with the configured parameters and returns the generated response from the AI model.
wrong_result:
<?php

require 'vendor/autoload.php';

use GuzzleHttp\Client;

class Ollama
{
    private $model;
    private $prompt;
    private $temperature;
    private $stream;
    private $raw;

    public function __construct(string $model, string $prompt, float $temperature, bool $stream, bool $raw)
    {
        $this->model = $model;
        $this->prompt = $prompt;
        $this->temperature = $temperature;
        $this->stream = $stream;
        $this->raw = $raw;
    }

    public function ask(): string
    {
        $client = new Client();

        $url = 'http://localhost:11434/api/generate';

        $body = json_encode([
            'model' => $this->model,
            'prompt' => $this->prompt,
            'temperature' => $this->temperature,
            'stream' => $this->stream,
            'raw' => $this->raw
        ]);

        $response = $client->post($url, [
            'headers' => ['Content-Type' => 'application/json'],
            'body' => $body
        ]);

        $ responseBody = $response->getBody()->getContents();

        return $responseBody;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements an HTTP client for sending payment requests to an e-payment API using Guzzle.

Class Description: The EpayHttpClient class is designed to handle HTTP communication with an e-payment API. It encapsulates the functionality for sending payment requests and processing the responses. The class uses Guzzle HTTP client for making requests and handles potential exceptions that may occur during the process.

Attributes:
- epay: array - Stores the configuration for the e-payment API
- client: Client - The Guzzle HTTP client instance used for making requests

Methods:
- __construct(array $epayConfig) -> void - Initializes the class with e-payment configuration and creates a new Guzzle Client instance
- sendPaymentRequest(array $data) -> array - Sends a payment request to the API endpoint and processes the response. Returns an array indicating success/failure and containing either the payment URL or an error message
wrong_result:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;

class EpayHttpClient
{
    protected $epay;
    protected $client;

    public function __construct(array $epayConfig)
    {
        $this->epay = $epayConfig;
        $this->client = new Client();
    }

    public function sendPaymentRequest(array $data): array
    {
        $url = $this->epay['api_url'] . '/payment';
        $headers = [
            'Content-Type' => 'application/json',
            'Authorization' => 'Bearer ' . $this->epay['api_token']
        ];

        try {
            $response = $this->client->post($url, [
                'headers' => $headers,
                'json' => $data
            ]);

            $ responseBody = json_decode($response->getBody(), true);

            if ($response->getStatusCode() === 200 && isset($responseBody['url'])) {
                return ['success' => true, 'payment_url' => $responseBody['url']];
            } else {
                return ['success' => false, 'error' => 'Payment request failed: ' . (isset($responseBody['message']) ? $responseBody['message'] : 'Unknown error')];
            }
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return ['success' => false, 'error' => 'HTTP error: ' . $e->getMessage()];
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            return ['success' => false, 'error' => 'An error occurred: ' . $e->getMessage()];
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified HTTP URL using fsockopen for low-level HTTP communication, with support for proxies and basic authentication.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to an HTTP server (or proxy), sends an HTTP GET request, reads the response, and returns the response body. It handles URL parsing, proxy configuration, timeout settings, and basic authentication. The function can either return the content directly or assign it to a template variable.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string, required) The HTTP URL to fetch
  - 'assign': (string, optional) Template variable name to assign content to
  - 'proxy_host': (string, optional) Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (int, optional) Proxy server port
  - 'timeout': (int, optional) Connection timeout in seconds (default: 30)
- $template: (object) The template object for assigning content (when 'assign' parameter is used)

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if 'assign' parameter is not provided
- Assigns content to the specified template variable and returns nothing if 'assign' parameter is provided
- Returns nothing and triggers notice on error conditions (invalid URL, connection failure)
wrong_result:
<?php
function fetch_http_content($params, $template) {
    $file = $params['file'];
    $assign = $params['assign'] ?? null;
    $proxy_host = $params['proxy_host'] ?? null;
    $proxy_port = $params['proxy_port'] ?? null;
    $timeout = $params['timeout'] ?? 30;

    // Parse URL
    $parsed = parse_url($file);
    if (!$parsed || !isset($parsed['host']) || !isset($parsed['path'])) {
        return;
    }

    $host = $parsed['host'];
    $port = isset($parsed['port']) ? $parsed['port'] : 80;
    $path = $parsed['path'] . (isset($parsed['query']) ? '?' . $parsed['query'] : '');
    $method = 'GET';
    $headers = "HTTP/1.1 $method $path\r\n";
    $headers .= "Host: $host\r\n";
    $headers .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";

    $socket = null;
    $auth_user = null;
    $auth_pass = null;

    if ($proxy_host && $proxy_port) {
        $proxy = "$proxy_host:$proxy_port";
        $socket = fsockopen($proxy, $proxy_port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
    } else {
        $socket = fsockopen($host, $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
    }

    if (!$socket) {
        return;
    }

    // Handle basic authentication
    if (isset($parsed['user']) && isset($parsed['pass'])) {
        $auth_user = $parsed['user'];
        $auth_pass = $parsed['pass'];
    }

    // Send request
    fwrite($socket, $headers);
    if ($auth_user && $auth_pass) {
        $auth = base64_encode("$auth_user:$auth_pass");
        fwrite($socket, "Authorization: Basic $auth\r\n");
    }

    // Read response
    $response = '';
    while (!feof($socket)) {
        $response .= fgets($socket, 1024);
    }

    fclose($socket);

    // Check for HTTP status
    if (substr($response, 0, 9) != 'HTTP/1.1 200') {
        return;
    }

    // Extract content
    $content_start = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
    if ($content_start === false) {
        return;
    }
    $content = substr($response, $content_start + 4);

    // Assign to template or return
    if ($assign) {
        $template->$assign = $content;
    } else {
        return $content;
    }
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a class that handles HTTP POST requests to Google's reCAPTCHA verification service using low-level socket operations in PHP.

Class Description: ReCaptchaSocketPostRequestMethod is a class that implements reCAPTCHA verification by establishing a direct socket connection to Google's servers, sending an HTTP POST request, and processing the response. It provides an alternative to higher-level HTTP clients.

Attributes:
- socket: [ReCaptchaSocket] - The socket connection handler used for HTTP communication
- RECAPTCHA_HOST: [string] - Constant storing Google's reCAPTCHA hostname ('www.google.com')
- SITE_VERIFY_PATH: [string] - Constant storing the reCAPTCHA verification endpoint path ('/recaptcha/api/siteverify')
- BAD_REQUEST: [string] - Constant JSON response for failed requests
- BAD_RESPONSE: [string] - Constant JSON response for invalid server responses

Methods:
- __construct([ReCaptchaSocket $socket = null]) -> [void] - Initializes the class with an optional socket dependency injection
- submit(ReCaptchaRequestParameters $params) -> [string] - Performs the reCAPTCHA verification by:
  1. Opening an SSL socket connection to Google's server
  2. Formatting and sending an HTTP POST request with verification parameters
  3. Reading and parsing the server response
  4. Returning the verification result as JSON string
  Returns either the server response or error JSON if the request/response fails
wrong_result:
<?php
class ReCaptchaSocketPostRequestMethod {
    public $socket;
    const RECAPTCHA_HOST = 'www.google.com';
    const SITE_VERIFY_PATH = '/recaptcha/api/siteverify';
    const BAD_REQUEST = '{"error": "bad_request"}';
    const BAD_RESPONSE = '{"error": "bad_response"}';

    public function __construct($socket = null) {
        $this->socket = $socket;
    }

    public function submit(ReCaptchaRequestParameters $params) {
        $host = self::RECAPTCHA_HOST;
        $path = self::SITE_VERIFY_PATH;
        $url = "https://$host$path";

        $request = "POST $path HTTP/1.1\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($params->getFormData()) . "\r\n\r\n";
        $request .= $params->getFormData();

        if ($this->socket === null) {
            $this->socket = new ReCaptchaSocket();
        }

        if (!$this->socket->connect($host, 443)) {
            return self::BAD_REQUEST;
        }

        if (!$this->socket->send($request)) {
            return self::BAD_REQUEST;
        }

        $response = '';
        while (!feof($this->socket)) {
            $response .= fgets($this->socket, 1024);
        }

        $response = trim($response);
        if (strpos($response, 'success') !== false) {
            return $response;
        } else {
            return self::BAD_RESPONSE;
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class for handling HTTP/HTTPS communications using either socket-based connections (via fsockopen) or cURL, supporting both standard and persistent connections, with proper header and cookie management.

Class Description: The soap_transport_http class provides low-level HTTP transport capabilities for SOAP communications, supporting both socket and cURL implementations. It handles connection management, request/response processing, and error handling.

Attributes:
- url: string - The target URL for HTTP requests
- uri: string - The URI portion of the URL
- scheme: string - The protocol scheme (http/https)
- host: string - The target hostname
- port: string - The target port number
- path: string - The path portion of the URL
- request_method: string - HTTP method (default: POST)
- protocol_version: string - HTTP version (default: 1.0)
- outgoing_headers: array - Headers to be sent with the request
- incoming_headers: array - Headers received in the response
- outgoing_payload: string - Data to be sent in the request
- incoming_payload: string - Data received in the response
- persistentConnection: bool - Flag for persistent connections
- use_curl: bool - Flag to use cURL instead of sockets
- proxy: array|null - Proxy configuration if used

Methods:
- __construct(string $url, array $curl_options=null, bool $use_curl=false) -> void - Initializes the transport with target URL and options
- connect(int $connection_timeout=0, int $response_timeout=30) -> bool - Establishes connection to server
- send(string $data, int $timeout=0, int $response_timeout=30, array $cookies=null) -> mixed - Sends data and returns response
- sendRequest(string $data, array $cookies=null) -> bool - Sends the HTTP request with headers
- getResponse() -> string|bool - Reads and processes the server response
- setHeader(string $name, string $value) -> void - Adds a header to outgoing request
- setCurlOption(mixed $option, mixed $value) -> void - Sets cURL option when using cURL
- parseCookie(string $cookie_str) -> array|bool - Parses Set-Cookie header into array
wrong_result:
<?php
class soap_transport_http {
    public $url;
    public $uri;
    public $scheme;
    public $host;
    public $port;
    public $path;
    public $request_method = 'POST';
    public $protocol_version = '1.0';
    public $outgoing_headers = array();
    public $incoming_headers = array();
    public $outgoing_payload;
    public $incoming_payload;
    public $persistentConnection = false;
    public $use_curl = false;
    public $proxy = null;

    public function __construct(string $url, array $curl_options = null, bool $use_curl = false) {
        $this->url = $url;
        $this->parse_url($url);
        $this->use_curl = $use_curl;
        if ($curl_options !== null) {
            $this->setCurlOption(CURLOPT_URL, $url);
            foreach ($curl_options as $key => $value) {
                $this->setCurlOption($key, $value);
            }
        }
    }

    private function parse_url(string $url) {
        $parts = parse_url($url);
        $this->scheme = $parts['scheme'] ?? 'http';
        $this->host = $parts['host'] ?? '';
        $this->port = $parts['port'] ?? ($this->scheme === 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $this->path = $parts['path'] ?? '/';
        $this->uri = $this->scheme . '://' . $this->host . ($this->port != 80 && $this->port != 443 ? ':' . $this->port : '') . $this->path;
    }

    public function connect(int $connection_timeout = 0, int $response_timeout = 30): bool {
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            return $this->connect_curl($connection_timeout, $response_timeout);
        } else {
            return $this->connect_socket($connection_timeout, $response_timeout);
        }
    }

    private function connect_curl(int $connection_timeout = 0, int $response_timeout = 30): bool {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $this->uri);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $connection_timeout);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION, $this->protocol_version);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        if ($this->proxy !== null) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, $this->proxy['host'] . ':' . $this->proxy['port']);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXYUSERPWD, $this->proxy['user'] . ':' . $this->proxy['pass']);
        }
        $this->setCurlOption(CURLOPT_HANDLE, $ch);
        return true;
    }

    private function connect_socket(int $connection_timeout = 0, int $response_timeout = 30): bool {
        $fp = fsockopen($this->scheme . '://' . $this->host . ($this->port != 80 && $this->port != 443 ? ':' . $this->port : ''), $this->port, $errno, $errstr, $connection_timeout);
        if (!$fp) {
            return false;
        }
        stream_set_timeout($fp, $response_timeout);
        $this->fp = $fp;
        return true;
    }

    public function send(string $data, int $timeout = 0, int $response_timeout = 30, array $cookies = null): mixed {
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            return $this->send_curl($data, $timeout, $response_timeout, $cookies);
        } else {
            return $this->send_socket($data, $timeout, $response_timeout, $cookies);
        }
    }

    private function send_curl(string $data, int $timeout = 0, int $response_timeout = 30, array $cookies = null): mixed {
        $ch = $this->get_curl_handle();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $timeout);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION, $this->protocol_version);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        if ($cookies) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_COOKIEJAR, tempnam(sys_get_temp_dir(), 'soap_cookie'));
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_COOKIEFILE, tempnam(sys_get_temp_dir(), 'soap_cookie'));
            foreach ($cookies as $name => $value) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_COOKIE, "$name=$value");
            }
        }
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $this->incoming_payload = substr($response, curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE));
        $this->incoming_headers = explode("\r\n", substr($response, 0, curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE)));
        return $this->incoming_payload;
    }

    private function send_socket(string $data, int $timeout = 0, int $response_timeout = 30, array $cookies = null): mixed {
        if (!is_resource($this->fp)) {
            return false;
        }
        $this->send_headers($data);
        $this->send_payload($data);
        $this->incoming_payload = '';
        while (!feof($this->fp)) {
            $this->incoming_payload .= fgets($this->fp, 4096);
        }
        $this->incoming_headers = explode("\r\n", substr($this->incoming_payload, 0, strpos($this->incoming_payload, "\r\n\r\n")));
        return $this->incoming_payload;
    }

    private function send_headers(string $data) {
        $headers = $this->build_headers();
        $this->fp = fwrite($this->fp, $headers . "\r\n\r\n");
    }

    private function build_headers() {
        $headers = $this->request_method . ' ' . $this->uri . ' ' . $this->protocol_version . "\r\n";
        foreach ($this->outgoing_headers as $name => $value) {
            $headers .= $name . ': ' . $value . "\r\n";
        }
        $headers .= 'Host: ' . $this->host . "\r\n";
        $headers .= 'Connection: ' . ($this->persistentConnection ? 'Keep-Alive' : 'Close') . "\r\n";
        $headers .= 'User-Agent: PHP/soap_transport_http' . "\r\n";
        $headers .= 'Accept: */*' . "\r\n";
        $headers .= 'Content-Length: ' . strlen($this->outgoing_payload) . "\r\n";
        $headers .= "\r\n";
        return $headers;
    }

    private function send_payload(string $data) {
        $this->fp = fwrite($this->fp, $data);
    }

    public function getResponse(): string|bool {
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            return $this->get_response_curl();
        } else {
            return $this->get_response_socket();
        }
    }

    private function get_response_curl(): string|bool {
        $ch = $this->get_curl_handle();
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $this->incoming_payload = substr($response, curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE));
        $this->incoming_headers = explode("\r\n", substr($response, 0, curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE)));
        return $this->incoming_payload;
    }

    private function get_response_socket(): string|bool {
        if (!is_resource($this->fp)) {
            return false;
        }
        $this->incoming_payload = '';
        while (!feof($this->fp)) {
            $this->incoming_payload .= fgets($this->fp, 4096);
        }
        $this->incoming_headers = explode("\r\n", substr($this->incoming_payload, 0, strpos($this->incoming_payload, "\r\n\r\n")));
        return $this->incoming_payload;
    }

    public function setHeader(string $name, string $value): void {
        $this->outgoing_headers[$name] = $value;
    }

    public function setCurlOption(mixed $option, mixed $value): void {
        $this->curl_options[$option] = $value;
    }

    private function get_curl_handle() {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $this->uri);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $this->connection_timeout);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION, $this->protocol_version);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        if ($this->proxy !== null) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, $this->proxy['host'] . ':' . $this->proxy['port']);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXYUSERPWD, $this->proxy['user'] . ':' . $this->proxy['pass']);
        }
        foreach ($this->curl_options as $key => $value) {
            curl_setopt($ch, $key, $value);
        }
        return $ch;
    }

    public function parseCookie(string $cookie_str): array|bool {
        $cookies = array();
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $cookie_str);
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (strpos($line, 'Set-Cookie:') === 0) {
                $cookie = str_replace('Set-Cookie:', '', $line);
                $cookie = trim($cookie);
                $parts = explode(';', $cookie);
                $cookie_array = array();
                foreach ($parts as $part) {
                    $part = trim($part);
                    if (strpos($part, '=') === false) {
                        continue;
                    }
                    list($name, $value) = explode('=', $part, 2);
                    $cookie_array[$name] = $value;
                }
                $cookies[] = $cookie_array;
            }
        }
        return $cookies;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a remote HTTP server using low-level socket operations, with support for various HTTP request parameters and proxy configuration.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to an HTTP server (or proxy), sends an HTTP GET request with customizable headers, reads the response, and returns the content body. It supports authentication, custom headers, timeout settings, and proxy configuration. The function can either return the content directly or assign it to a template variable.

Input:
- $params: [array] - An associative array containing the following possible keys:
  - 'file': [string] - The URL to fetch (required)
  - 'assign': [string] - Template variable name to assign content to (optional)
  - 'assign_headers': [string] - Template variable name to assign response headers to (optional)
  - 'user': [string] - Username for HTTP authentication (optional)
  - 'pass': [string] - Password for HTTP authentication (optional)
  - 'accept': [string] - Accept header value (optional)
  - 'header': [string|array] - Additional HTTP headers (optional)
  - 'proxy_host': [string] - Proxy server hostname (optional)
  - 'proxy_port': [int] - Proxy server port (optional)
  - 'agent': [string] - User-Agent header value (optional)
  - 'referer': [string] - Referer header value (optional)
  - 'timeout': [int] - Connection timeout in seconds (optional)
- $template: [object] - Template engine object for variable assignment (optional)

Output:
- If 'assign' parameter is provided: [void] - Assigns content to template variable
- If 'assign' parameter is not provided: [string] - Returns the fetched content
- On error: [void] - Triggers notice and returns nothing

            break;
        }
        if ($read === 0) {
            break;
        }
        $response .= $recv;
        if (strpos($recv, "\r\n\r\n") !== false) {
            $headers_received = true;
            break;
        }
    }

    if (!$headers_received) {
        trigger_error("No response body received.", E_USER_NOTICE);
        socket_close($socket);
        return;
    }

    $response_lines = explode("\r\n", $response);
    $status_line = $response_lines[0];
    $status_code = substr($status_line, 8, 3);

    if ($status_code != '200') {
        trigger_error("HTTP request failed with status code $status_code.", E_USER_NOTICE);
        socket_close($socket);
        return;
    }

    $body_start = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n") + 4;
    $body = substr($response, $body_start);

    if (isset($params['assign'])) {
        if ($template) {
            $template->assign($params['assign'], $body);
            if (isset($params['assign_headers'])) {
                $template->assign($params['assign_headers'], $response_lines);
            }
        } else {
            trigger_error("Template object not provided for assignment.", E_USER_NOTICE);
        }
    } else {
        return $body;
    }

    socket_close($socket);
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using fsockopen for making HTTP requests when CURL extension is not available. The class should support both GET and POST methods, handle headers, cookies, timeouts, and allow configuration of various connection parameters.

Class Description: The Http class provides low-level HTTP client functionality using PHP's fsockopen function. It's designed as a fallback when CURL isn't available, offering stable performance for making HTTP requests. The class contains one static method that handles the complete HTTP request lifecycle from connection establishment to response processing.

Methods:

Method1: fsockopenDownload(string $url, array $conf = []) -> mixed - Performs an HTTP request using fsockopen
  Input Parameters:
    - $url: string - The target URL to request
    - $conf: array - Configuration options including:
      - limit: int - Maximum bytes to read (0 for unlimited)
      - post: mixed - POST data (array or string)
      - cookie: string - Cookie header content
      - ip: string - Force specific IP address
      - timeout: int - Connection timeout in seconds
      - block: bool - Whether to use blocking mode
  Return Type: mixed - Returns the HTTP response body as string, or empty string on failure

The method follows these steps:
1. Parses the URL and merges configuration with defaults
2. Prepares appropriate HTTP request headers (GET/POST)
3. Establishes TCP connection using fsockopen
4. Sends the HTTP request
5. Reads and processes the response
6. Closes the connection and returns the response body

<?php
class Http {
    public static function fsockopenDownload(string $url, array $conf = []): mixed {
        $defaults = [
            'limit' => 0,
            'post' => null,
            'cookie' => '',
            'ip' => '',
            'timeout' => 30,
            'block' => true
        ];

        $config = array_merge($defaults, $conf);

        $parsedUrl = parse_url($url);
        if (!isset($parsedUrl['scheme']) || !isset($parsedUrl['host'])) {
            return '';
        }

        $host = $parsedUrl['host'];
        $port = isset($parsedUrl['port']) ? $parsedUrl['port'] : 80;
        $path = $parsedUrl['path'] . (isset($parsedUrl['query']) ? '?' . $parsedUrl['query'] : '');
        $method = $config['post'] !== null ? 'POST' : 'GET';

        $headers = [];
        if ($config['cookie']) {
            $headers[] = 'Cookie: ' . $config['cookie'];
        }
        $headers[] = 'Host: ' . $host;
        $headers[] = 'User-Agent: PHP/HTTP client';
        $headers[] = 'Accept: */*';
        $headers[] = 'Connection: close';

        $request = $method . ' ' . $path . ' HTTP/1.1\r\n';
        $request .= implode("\r\n", $headers) . "\r\n";

        $context = stream_context_create();
        if ($config['ip']) {
            stream_context_set_option($context, 'socket', 'local_ip', $config['ip']);
        }
        stream_context_set_option($context, 'socket', 'timeout', $config['timeout']);

        $fp = @fsockopen($host, $port, $errno, $errstr, $config['timeout'], $context);
        if (!$fp) {
            return '';
        }

        if ($config['block']) {
            fwrite($fp, $request);
        } else {
            $write = fwrite($fp, $request);
            if ($write === false) {
                fclose($fp);
                return '';
            }
        }

        $response = '';
        $contentLength = 0;
        $chunkSize = 4096;
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $data = fread($fp, $chunkSize);
            if ($data === false) {
                break;
            }
            $response .= $data;
            $contentLength += strlen($data);
            if ($config['limit'] > 0 && $contentLength >= $config['limit']) {
                break;
            }
        }

        fclose($fp);
        return $response;
    }
}

      - post: string|array - POST content (either as string or array for form data)
      - cookie: string - Cookie content to send with request

        ];

        $parsed_url = parse_url($url);
        $host = $parsed_url['host'];
        $path = $parsed_url['path'] ?? '/';
        $port = $parsed_url['port'] ?? 80;
        $method = $_SERVER['REQUEST_METHOD'] ?? 'GET';

        }

        }
        $request .= "\r\n";

        $fp = false;
        if ($config['ip']) {
            $socket = fsockopen($config['ip'], $port, $errno, $errstr, $config['timeout']);
        } else {

        }

        if (!$socket) {
            return '';
        }

        if ($method === 'POST') {
            if (is_array($config['post'])) {
                $post_data = http_build_query($config['post']);
            } else {
                $post_data = $config['post'];
            }
            fwrite($socket, $request . $post_data . "\r\n");
        } else {
            fwrite($socket, $request);
        }

        $response = '';
        $buffer = '';
        while (!feof($socket)) {
            $buffer .= fread($socket, 8192);
            if ($config['limit'] > 0 && strlen($buffer) >= $config['limit']) {
                break;
            }
        }

        fclose($socket);
        return $buffer;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements an HTTP client using low-level socket operations (fsockopen) to send HTTP requests and handle responses, with logging capabilities.

Class Description: SocketHttpClient is a PSR-compatible HTTP client that establishes direct socket connections to HTTP servers, sends requests, and processes responses. It implements both a custom HTTP client interface and PSR-18's ClientInterface, while also supporting PSR-3 logging.

Attributes:
- logger: [LoggerInterface] - PSR-3 logger instance for tracking connection attempts, errors, and debug information

Methods:
- __construct([LoggerInterface $logger]) -> [void] - Initializes the client with a PSR-3 logger instance
- sendRequest([RequestInterface $request]) -> [ResponseInterface] - Sends an HTTP request and returns the response. Handles both HTTP and HTTPS connections, processes headers and body, and manages socket lifecycle. Returns a PSR-7 response object.
wrong_result:
<?php

use Psr\Http\Message\RequestInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface;
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;
use Psr\Log\LogLevel;
use Psr\Http\Message\UriInterface;
use Psr\Http\Message\StreamInterface;
use InvalidArgumentException;

class SocketHttpClient implements \Psr\Http\Client\ClientInterface
{
    protected $logger;

    public function __construct(LoggerInterface $logger = null)
    {
        $this->logger = $logger ?: new \Monolog\Logger('socket_http_client');
    }

    public function sendRequest(RequestInterface $request): ResponseInterface
    {
        $uri = $request->getUri();
        $method = $request->getMethod();
        $headers = $request->getHeaders();
        $body = $request->getBody();

        $this->logger->log(LogLevel::INFO, "Sending HTTP request to {$uri}");

        $host = $uri->getHost();
        $port = $uri->getPort() ?: 80;
        $path = $uri->getPath();
        $query = $uri->getQuery();
        $scheme = $uri->getScheme();

        $requestLine = "$method $path?$query HTTP/1.1";

        $socket = fsockopen($scheme . '://' . $host . ':' . $port, 'tcp', $errno, $errstr, 30);
        if (!$socket) {
            $this->logger->log(LogLevel::ERROR, "Failed to connect to {$host}:{$port} - Error: $errstr ($errno)");
            throw new InvalidArgumentException("Could not connect to server: $errstr ($errno)");
        }

        $this->logger->log(LogLevel::DEBUG, "Connected to {$host}:{$port}");

        fwrite($socket, "$requestLine\r\n");
        foreach ($headers as $name => $values) {
            foreach ($values as $value) {
                fwrite($socket, "$name: $value\r\n");
            }
        }
        fwrite($socket, "\r\n");

        if ($body instanceof StreamInterface) {
            $body->rewind();
            while (!feof($socket)) {
                $data = fread($socket, 8192);
                if ($data === false) {
                    break;
                }
                $body->write($data);
            }
        }

        $response = $this->getResponseFromSocket($socket);
        $this->logger->log(LogLevel::INFO, "Received response from {$host}:{$port}");
        return $response;
    }

    protected function getResponseFromSocket($socket): ResponseInterface
    {
        $statusLine = "";
        while (strlen($statusLine) < 4) {
            $statusLine .= fgets($socket);
        }

        list($version, $statusCode, $reasonPhrase) = explode(' ', trim($statusLine), 3);

        $headers = [];
        while (fgets($socket) !== "\r\n") {
            $line = trim(fgets($socket));
            if ($line) {
                list($name, $value) = explode(': ', $line, 2);
                $headers[$name][] = $value;
            }
        }

        $body = '';
        while (!feof($socket)) {
            $body .= fread($socket, 8192);
        }

        return new \Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface(
            $version,
            $statusCode,
            $reasonPhrase,
            $headers,
            $body
        );
    }
}

- $pass (string): The password for RabbitMQ authentication

<?php
function rabbitmq_consumer($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost, $exchange, $queue, $consumerTag) {
    // Create a connection to the RabbitMQ server
    $connection = new AMQPConnection([
        'host' => $host,
        'port' => $port,
        'login' => $user,
        'password' => $pass,
        'vhost' => $vhost
    ]);

    // Create a channel
    $channel = new AMQPChannel($connection);

    // Declare an exchange
    $exchange_declare = new AMQPExchangeDeclare($channel);
    $exchange_declare->setExchange($exchange);
    $exchange_declare->setType(AMQP_EX_TYPE_DIRECT);
    $exchange_declare->setPassive(false);
    $exchange_declare->setDurable(true);
    $exchange_declare->setAutoDelete(false);
    $exchange_declare->declare();

    // Declare a queue
    $queue_declare = new AMQPQueueDeclare($channel);
    $queue_declare->setName($queue);
    $queue_declare->setPassive(false);
    $queue_declare->setDurable(true);
    $queue_declare->setExclusive(false);
    $queue_declare->setAutoDelete(false);
    $queue_declare->declare();

    // Bind the queue to the exchange
    $bind = new AMQPBinding($channel);
    $bind->setExchange($exchange);
    $bind->setQueue($queue);
    $bind->setRoutingKey($queue);
    $bind->bind();

    // Start consuming messages
    $consumer = new AMQPConsumer($channel);
    $consumer->setQueue($queue);
    $consumer->setConsumerTag($consumerTag);
    $consumer->setNoLocal(false);
    $consumer->setExclusive(false);
    $consumer->setAutoAck(false);
    $consumer->consume();

    // Process messages
    while (true) {
        $message = $consumer->wait();
        if ($message === false) {
            break;
        }

        $content = $message->getBody();
        echo "Received message: $content\n";

        if ($content === 'quit') {
            break;
        }

        // Acknowledge the message
        $message->ack();
    }

    // Close the channel and connection
    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();
}
?>

It processes each message by acknowledging "good" messages and rejecting others. If the message body is "quit", it stops consuming. The function includes proper cleanup by closing the channel and connection on shutdown.

Input:
- $host: string - RabbitMQ server hostname
- $port: int - RabbitMQ server port
- $user: string - RabbitMQ username
- $pass: string - RabbitMQ password  
- $vhost: string - RabbitMQ virtual host

- $queue: string - Queue name to consume from

<?php
function rabbitmq_consumer($host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost, $exchange, $queue, $consumerTag) {
    // Create connection
    $connection = new AMQPConnection([
        'host' => $host,
        'port' => $port,
        'login' => $user,
        'password' => $pass,
        'vhost' => $vhost
    ]);

    // Create channel
    $channel = new AMQPChannel($connection);

    // Declare exchange
    $exchangeDecl = new AMQPExchange($channel);
    $exchangeDecl->declare($exchange, AMQP_EX_TYPE_DIRECT);

    // Declare queue
    $queueDecl = new AMQPQueue($channel);
    $queueDecl->declare($queue, AMQP_QUEUE_TYPE_DEFAULT);

    // Bind queue to exchange
    $queueDecl->bind($exchange, $queue);

    // Start consuming
    $queueDecl->consume(function ($delivery, $properties, $body) use ($consumerTag) {
        // Process message
        if ($body === "quit") {
            // Stop consuming
            $delivery->nack();
            $queueDecl->cancel($consumerTag);
            $channel->close();
            $connection->close();
            return;
        }

        // Acknowledge "good" messages
        if (strpos($body, 'good') !== false) {
            $delivery->ack();
        } else {
            // Reject other messages
            $delivery->nack();
        }
    }, $consumerTag);

    // Handle connection shutdown
    $connection->setOnShutdown(function () use ($channel, $queueDecl) {
        $queueDecl->cancel($consumerTag);
        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();
    });
}
?>

Task Description: Create a function that sends multiple messages to a RabbitMQ queue using PHP and measures the execution time for the operation.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, creates a temporary queue, sends a specified number of messages with the given content, and returns the total time taken to complete the operation. Each message is sent through a newly created channel, and the temporary queue is automatically deleted after use.

Input:
- $max_messages: [int] - The number of messages to send.
- $host: [string] - The hostname or IP address of the RabbitMQ server.
- $port: [int] - The port number of the RabbitMQ server.
- $user: [string] - The username for RabbitMQ authentication.
- $pass: [string] - The password for RabbitMQ authentication.
- $vhost: [string] - The virtual host to connect to on the RabbitMQ server.
- $message_body: [string] - The content of the message to be sent.

Output:
- [float] - The total execution time in seconds for sending all messages, or false if the connection fails.
wrong_result:
<?php
function send_messages_to_rabbitmq($max_messages, $host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost, $message_body) {
    $start_time = microtime(true);

    try {
        // Create a connection to RabbitMQ
        $connection = new AMQPConnection([
            'host' => $host,
            'port' => $port,
            'login' => $user,
            'password' => $pass,
            'vhost' => $vhost
        ]);
        $connection->connect();

        // Create a channel
        $channel = new AMQPChannel($connection);

        // Create a temporary queue
        $queue = new AMQPQueue($channel);
        $queue->declare_queue(['exclusive' => true]);

        // Send messages
        for ($i = 0; $i < $max_messages; $i++) {
            $message = new AMQPMessage($message_body);
            $queue->publish($message);
        }

        // Delete the temporary queue
        $queue->delete();

        // Close the channel and connection
        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();

        $end_time = microtime(true);
        return $end_time - $start_time;
    } catch (Exception $e) {
        return false;
    }
}
?>

- `$delay_ms` [int] - The delay time in milliseconds before the message is delivered to the queue.

Output: None. The function does not return any value but publishes the message to the specified RabbitMQ queue with the given delay.

Note: The function assumes the existence of a `config.php` file containing the RabbitMQ connection parameters (HOST, PORT, USER, PASS, VHOST).

require_once 'config.php';
use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPConnectionFactory;
use PhpAmqpLib\Channel\AMQPChannel;
use PhpAmqpLib\Exchange\AMQPExchangeType;

function send_delayed_message($message_content, $delay_ms) {
    // Create connection
    $connection = new AMQPConnectionFactory($HOST, $PORT, $USER, $PASS, $VHOST);
    $channel = $connection->createChannel();

    // Declare a delayed exchange (using x-delayed-message plugin)
    $exchange_name = 'delayed_exchange';

    $props->headers = ['x-delay' => $delay_ms];

    $connection->close();
}

Input:  
- $messageBody: [string] - The content of the message to be sent  
- $exchange: [string] - The name of the exchange (default: 'router')  
- $queue: [string] - The name of the queue (default: 'msgs')

- [bool] - Returns true if the message was successfully sent, false if an error occurred

require_once __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';

use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Channel\AMQPChannel;
use PhpAmqpLib\Exception\AMQPException;

function sendToRabbitMQ($messageBody, $exchange = 'router', $queue = 'msgs') {
    try {
        $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection('localhost', 5672, 'guest', 'guest');
        $channel = $connection->channel();

        $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false, false, false);
        $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'direct', false, false, false, false, false);

        $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange);

        $properties = amqp_message_properties(array(
            'delivery_mode' => 2 // persistent
        ));

        $channel->basic_publish(amqp_message_init($messageBody, $properties), $exchange, $queue);

        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();

        return true;
    } catch (AMQPException $e) {
        error_log("RabbitMQ error: " . $e->getMessage());
        return false;
    } catch (\Exception $e) {
        error_log("Error: " . $e->getMessage());
        return false;
    }
}

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, declares an exchange and queue, then publishes a specified number of messages in configurable batch sizes. It handles connection blocking scenarios and returns the total execution time. A special 'quit' message is sent at the end to signal completion.

Input:
- $msg_count: [integer] - The total number of messages to publish
- $batch_size: [integer] - The number of messages to send in each batch
- $host: [string] - RabbitMQ server hostname
- $port: [integer] - RabbitMQ server port
- $user: [string] - RabbitMQ username
- $pass: [string] - RabbitMQ password
- $vhost: [string] - RabbitMQ virtual host

Output:
- [float] - The total execution time in seconds for sending all messages

<?php
function publishMessagesToRabbitMQ($msg_count, $batch_size, $host, $port, $user, $pass, $vhost) {
    $start_time = microtime(true);

    // Connect to RabbitMQ
    $connection = new AMQPConnection([
        'host' => $host,
        'port' => $port,
        'login' => $user,
        'password' => $pass,
        'vhost' => $vhost
    ]);
    $channel = new AMQPChannel($connection);

    // Declare exchange and queue
    $exchange = new AMQPExchange($channel);
    $queue = new AMQPQueue($channel);

    $exchange->declare('task_exchange', AMQP_EX_TYPE_DIRECT);
    $queue->declare('task_queue', AMQP_QUEUE_TYPE_DEFAULT);
    $queue->bind('task_exchange', 'task_routing_key');

    // Send messages in batches
    for ($i = 0; $i < $msg_count; $i += $batch_size) {
        $messages = [];
        for ($j = $i; $j < min($i + $batch_size, $msg_count); $j++) {
            $messages[] = 'Message ' . $j;
        }

        // Publish messages
        foreach ($messages as $message) {
            $exchange->publish($message, 'task_routing_key');
        }
    }

    // Send quit message
    $exchange->publish('quit', 'task_routing_key');

    // Close connection
    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();

    $end_time = microtime(true);
    return $end_time - $start_time;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a UDP scraper class for interacting with BitTorrent trackers to scrape torrent statistics using UDP protocol.

Class Description: UdpScraper is a class that handles communication with BitTorrent trackers via UDP protocol to retrieve scrape information (seeders, leechers, downloads) for given torrent info hashes. It manages socket connections, transaction IDs, and packet formatting according to the UDP tracker protocol.

Attributes:
- currentConnectionId: [string] - The connection ID received from the tracker after initial connection
- transactionId: [int] - The current transaction ID used for request/response tracking
- socket: [resource|null] - The UDP socket resource for communication
- timeout: [int] - Socket timeout in seconds for send/receive operations

Methods:
- scrape([Tracker $tracker, array $hashes]) -> [array] - Main method to scrape multiple torrent hashes by splitting them into chunks
- scrapeChunk([Tracker $tracker, array $hashes]) -> [array] - Scrapes a chunk of torrent hashes (max 74 at a time)
- initSocket() -> [resource] - Initializes and returns a UDP socket
- connect([string $domain, int $port]) -> [void] - Connects the socket to the tracker
- generateTransactionId() -> [void] - Generates a random transaction ID
- startTransaction() -> [void] - Initiates connection with the tracker and establishes connection ID
- scrapeHashes([array $hashes]) -> [array] - Sends scrape request for given hashes and processes response
- request([string $packet, int $readLength]) -> [string] - Sends packet and reads response with timeout
- closeSocket() -> [void] - Closes the socket and resets connection state
- checkError([string $response]) -> [void] - Checks for and handles error responses from tracker
wrong_result:
<?php
class UdpScraper {
    public $currentConnectionId;
    public $transactionId;
    public $socket;
    public $timeout;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->timeout = 5;
        $this->transactionId = 0;
        $this->currentConnectionId = '';
        $this->socket = null;
    }

    public function scrape($tracker, $hashes) {
        $chunks = array_chunk($hashes, 74);
        $results = [];

        foreach ($chunks as $chunk) {
            $results += $this->scrapeChunk($tracker, $chunk);
        }

        return $results;
    }

    public function scrapeChunk($tracker, $hashes) {
        $this->initSocket();
        $this->connect($tracker->domain, $tracker->port);
        $this->startTransaction();
        $response = $this->scrapeHashes($hashes);
        $this->closeSocket();

        return $response;
    }

    public function initSocket() {
        $this->socket = socket_create(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, SOL_UDP);
        if ($this->socket === false) {
            throw new Exception("Could not create socket: " . socket_strerror(socket_last_error()));
        }
        return $this->socket;
    }

    public function connect($domain, $port) {
        $result = socket_connect($this->socket, $domain, $port);
        if ($result === false) {
            throw new Exception("Could not connect to tracker: " . socket_strerror(socket_last_error($this->socket)));
        }
    }

    public function generateTransactionId() {
        $this->transactionId = mt_rand(1, 65535);
    }

    public function startTransaction() {
        $this->generateTransactionId();
        $this->currentConnectionId = $this->request(pack("n", $this->transactionId), 2);
    }

    public function scrapeHashes($hashes) {
        $packet = pack("n", $this->transactionId) . pack("n", count($hashes));
        foreach ($hashes as $hash) {
            $packet .= pack("H4", $hash);
        }

        $response = $this->request($packet, 2048);
        $this->checkError($response);

        $data = unpack("N*data", $response);
        $results = [];

        for ($i = 0; $i < count($hashes); $i++) {
            $hash = substr($data['data'], $i * 20, 20);
            $seeders = bindec(substr($data['data'], $i * 20 + 20, 4));
            $leechers = bindec(substr($data['data'], $i * 20 + 24, 4));
            $download = bindec(substr($data['data'], $i * 20 + 28, 4));
            $results[$hash] = [
                'seeders' => $seeders,
                'leechers' => $leechers,
                'download' => $download
            ];
        }

        return $results;
    }

    public function request($packet, $readLength) {
        $sent = socket_sendto($this->socket, $packet, 0, UDP_PORT, $this->currentConnectionId, $this->timeout);
        if ($sent === false) {
            throw new Exception("Could not send packet: " . socket_strerror(socket_last_error($this->socket)));
        }

        $response = '';
        $result = socket_recv($this->socket, $response, $readLength, 0);
        if ($result === false) {
            throw new Exception("Could not receive response: " . socket_strerror(socket_last_error($this->socket)));
        }

        return $response;
    }

    public function closeSocket() {
        if ($this->socket !== null) {
            socket_close($this->socket);
            $this->socket = null;
            $this->currentConnectionId = '';
            $this->transactionId = 0;
        }
    }

    public function checkError($response) {
        if (substr($response, 0, 1) === '\') {
            $error = substr($response, 1);
            throw new Exception("Tracker error: $error");
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that implements a basic TCP socket server capable of handling client connections, executing commands, and managing directory changes.

Function Description: The function starts a TCP socket server on a specified port, accepts client connections, and provides an interactive shell-like interface. It handles 'cd' commands for directory navigation, 'exit'/'quit' commands for termination, and executes other system commands. The server sends command outputs and current working directory information back to the client.

Input:
- $port: integer - The port number to bind the server socket to
- $wpxf_disabled: array - List of disabled functions/callables
- $wpxf_exec: callable - Function to execute system commands

Output: None (The function runs indefinitely until the client disconnects or sends an exit command)
wrong_result:
<?php
function startTcpSocketServer($port, $wpxf_disabled, $wpxf_exec) {
    $socket = socket_create(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, SOL_TCP);
    if ($socket === false) {
        echo "Failed to create socket: " . socket_strerror(socket_last_error()) . "\n";
        return;
    }

    $bind = socket_bind($socket, '127.0.0.1', $port);
    if ($bind === false) {
        echo "Binding failed: " . socket_strerror(socket_last_error($socket)) . "\n";
        return;
    }

    $listen = socket_listen($socket, 5);
    if ($listen === false) {
        echo "Listening failed: " . socket_strerror(socket_last_error($socket)) . "\n";
        return;
    }

    $cwd = getcwd();
    while (true) {
        $accept = socket_accept($socket, $client);
        if ($accept === false) {
            echo "Accept failed: " . socket_strerror(socket_last_error($socket)) . "\n";
            continue;
        }

        $output = "";
        while (true) {
            $read = [$client];
            $write = [];
            $except = [];
            $num_changed = socket_poll($read, $write, $except, 1);
            if ($num_changed === false) {
                echo "Poll failed: " . socket_strerror(socket_last_error($socket)) . "\n";
                break;
            }

            if (count($read) === 0) {
                break;
            }

            $input = '';
            $bytes_read = socket_recv($client, $input, 1024, 0);
            if ($bytes_read === false) {
                echo "Recv failed: " . socket_strerror(socket_last_error($client)) . "\n";
                break;
            }

            if ($input === '') {
                break;
            }

            $input = trim($input);
            if ($input === 'exit' || $input === 'quit') {
                socket_close($client);
                break;
            }

            if (strpos($input, 'cd ') === 0) {
                $dir = substr($input, 3);
                if (chdir($dir) === false) {
                    $output = "Failed to change directory: " . strerror(errno) . "\n";
                } else {
                    $output = "Changed directory to: " . getcwd() . "\n";
                }
            } else {
                $output = $wpxf_exec($input);
            }

            $output .= "Current working directory: " . getcwd() . "\n";
            socket_send($client, $output, strlen($output), 0);
        }

        socket_close($client);
    }

    socket_close($socket);
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a MySQL proxy class that handles communication between a client and MySQL server using Swoole's coroutine client for TCP/UDP communication, implementing authentication and packet handling.

Class Description: MysqlProxy - A class that manages MySQL protocol communication between client and server, handling connection establishment, authentication, packet processing, and error handling.

Attributes:

isDuplex: [bool] - Indicates whether duplex communication is supported by Swoole version
server: [swoole_server] - Swoole server instance
serverFd: [int] - File descriptor of the server connection
charset: [string] - Character set for MySQL communication
account: [array] - MySQL account credentials
auth: [bool] - Authentication status flag
chan: [Swoole\Coroutine\Channel] - Coroutine channel for communication
serverPublicKey: [string] - Server's public key for authentication
salt: [array] - Salt used for password encryption
connected: [bool] - Connection status flag
timeout: [float] - Connection timeout value
mysqlClient: [Swoole\Coroutine\Channel] - Channel for MySQL client communication
mysqlServer: [HandshakePacket] - Server handshake information
client: [Swoole\Coroutine\Client] - Coroutine client instance

Methods:

__construct: [function](swoole_server $server, int $fd, Swoole\Coroutine\Channel $chan) -> [void] - Initializes the proxy with server, file descriptor and channel
connect: [function](string $host, int $port, float $timeout = 0.1, int $tryStep = 0) -> [Client|bool] - Establishes connection to MySQL server with retry logic
onClientReceive: [function](Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli, string $data) -> [void] - Handles incoming data from MySQL server
processAuth: [function](string $pluginName) -> [array] - Processes authentication based on plugin type
send: [function](...$data) -> [bool] - Sends data to MySQL server
recv: [function](&$remain) -> [mixed] - Receives data from MySQL server
onClientClose: [function](Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli) -> [void] - Handles client connection closure
onClientError: [function](Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli) -> [void] - Handles client errors
wrong_result:
<?php
class MysqlProxy {
    public $isDuplex;
    public $server;
    public $serverFd;
    public $charset;
    public $account;
    public $auth;
    public $chan;
    public $serverPublicKey;
    public $salt;
    public $connected;
    public $timeout;
    public $mysqlClient;
    public $mysqlServer;
    public $client;

    public function __construct(swoole_server $server, int $fd, Swoole\Coroutine\Channel $chan) {
        $this->server = $server;
        $this->serverFd = $fd;
        $this->chan = $chan;
        $this->isDuplex = version_compare(SWOOLE_VERSION, '4.5.0', '>=');
        $this->connected = false;
        $this->timeout = 0.1;
    }

    public function connect(string $host, int $port, float $timeout = 0.1, int $tryStep = 0): Client|bool {
        $this->timeout = $timeout;
        $this->client = new Swoole\Coroutine\Client(SWOOLE_SOCK_TCP);
        $this->client->set([
            'open' => true,
            'write_timeout' => $timeout,
            'read_timeout' => $timeout
        ]);
        $res = $this->client->connect($host, $port, $timeout);
        if (!$res) {
            if ($tryStep < 3) {
                go(function () use ($host, $port, $timeout, $tryStep) {
                    sleep(1);
                    $this->connect($host, $port, $timeout, $tryStep + 1);
                });
            } else {
                return false;
            }
        }
        return $this->client;
    }

    public function onClientReceive(Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli, string $data) {
        $this->onClientReceiveData($data);
    }

    public function processAuth(string $pluginName): array {
        $result = [];
        switch ($pluginName) {
            case 'mysql_native_password':
                $result = $this->processNativePassword();
                break;
            case 'sha256_password':
                $result = $this->processSha256Password();
                break;
            default:
                $result = ['status' => false, 'data' => null];
        }
        return $result;
    }

    public function send(...$data): bool {
        return $this->client->send(implode('', $data));
    }

    public function recv(&$remain): mixed {
        $data = '';
        while (true) {
            $len = $this->client->recv($data, 8192);
            if ($len === false) {
                return false;
            }
            if ($len === 0) {
                return false;
            }
            $remain = $data;
            return $data;
        }
    }

    public function onClientClose(Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli) {
        $this->onClientCloseConnection();
    }

    public function onClientError(Swoole\Coroutine\Client $cli) {
        $this->onClientErrorConnection();
    }
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements a JSON-RPC client using Swoole's coroutine-based TCP client for asynchronous communication with a JSON-RPC server. The class should handle connection management, request/response serialization, and middleware processing.

Class Description: The Connection class provides a JSON-RPC client implementation using Swoole's coroutine client for TCP communication. It manages the connection lifecycle, handles JSON-RPC protocol serialization/deserialization, and supports middleware processing for requests.

Attributes:
- host: [string] - The hostname or IP address of the JSON-RPC server
- port: [int] - The port number of the JSON-RPC server
- timeout: [float] - Connection timeout in seconds
- callTimeout: [float] - Timeout for RPC calls in seconds
- middleware: [array] - Array of middleware objects to process requests
- client: [Swoole\Coroutine\Client] - The Swoole coroutine client instance (protected)

Methods:
- __construct([array $config = []]) -> [void] - Constructor that initializes the connection with optional configuration
- connect() -> [void] - Establishes a TCP connection to the JSON-RPC server
- call([Request $request]) -> [Response] - Sends a JSON-RPC request and returns the response, processing through middleware
- close() -> [void] - Closes the connection to the server
- recv([float $timeout = -1]) -> [string] - Receives data from the server with optional timeout (protected)

<?php
class Connection {
    protected $host;
    protected $port;
    protected $timeout;
    protected $callTimeout;
    protected $middleware;
    protected $client;

    public function __construct(array $config = []) {
        $this->host = $config['host'] ?? '127.0.0.1';
        $this->port = $config['port'] ?? 9000;
        $this->timeout = $config['timeout'] ?? 5.0;
        $this->callTimeout = $config['callTimeout'] ?? 3.0;
        $this->middleware = $config['middleware'] ?? [];
        $this->client = new Swoole\Coroutine\Client(SWOOLE_SOCK_TCP, SWOOLE_CLIENT_KEEP);
    }

    public function connect() {
        $this->client->set([
            'timeout' => $this->timeout,
            'write_buffer_size' => 1024 * 1024
        ]);
        $connected = $this->client->connect($this->host, $this->port, $this->timeout);
        if (!$connected) {
            throw new Exception("Connection to {$this->host}:{$this->port} failed: " . $this->client->getError());
        }
    }

    public function call($request) {
        foreach ($this->middleware as $middleware) {
            $request = $middleware->process($request);
        }

        $this->send(json_encode($request));
        $response = $this->recv($this->callTimeout);
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    public function close() {
        $this->client->close();
    }

    protected function recv($timeout = -1) {
        $data = $this->client->recv($timeout);
        if (false === $data) {
            throw new Exception("Receive failed: " . $this->client->getError());
        }
        return $data;
    }

    protected function send($data) {
        $sent = $this->client->send($data);
        if ($sent < strlen($data)) {
            throw new Exception("Send failed: " . $this->client->getError());
        }
    }
}

Function Description: The function executes a given shell command as a subprocess and returns its standard output. It handles both string and array command formats, manages Windows code page settings if applicable, and ensures proper cleanup of resources. The function returns null if proc_open is unavailable or if process creation fails.

<?php
function executeCommand($command) {
    if (function_exists('proc_open')) {
        $descriptorspec = array(
            0 => array('pipe', 'r'),  // stdin
            1 => array('pipe', 'w'),  // stdout
            2 => array('pipe', 'w')   // stderr
        );

        $process = proc_open($command, $descriptorspec, $pipes);

        if (is_resource($process)) {
            $output = '';
            $errorOutput = '';

            while (!feof($pipes[1])) {
                $output .= fread($pipes[1], 1024);
            }

            while (!feof($pipes[2])) {
                $errorOutput .= fread($pipes[2], 1024);
            }

            fclose($pipes[1]);
            fclose($pipes[2]);
            proc_close($process);

            if ($errorOutput) {
                return null;
            }

            return $output;
        }
    }

    return null;
}

<?php
class ProcessHandler {
    public $process;
    public $command;
    public $cwd;
    public $pipes;

    public function __construct(string $command, int|string|Level $level = Level::Debug, bool $bubble = true, ?string $cwd = null) {
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
    }

    public function write(LogRecord $record) {
        $formatted = $record->format();
        $this->writeProcessInput($formatted);
    }

    public function close() {
        if ($this->process) {
            fclose($this->pipes['stdin']);
            fclose($this->pipes['stdout']);
            fclose($this->pipes['stderr']);
            pclose($this->process);
            $this->process = null;
        }
    }

    public function ensureProcessIsStarted() {
        if (!$this->process) {
            $this->startProcess();
        }
    }

    public function startProcess() {
        $descriptorspec = [
            0 => ['pipe', 'r'],  // stdin is a pipe that the child will read from
            1 => ['pipe', 'w'],  // stdout is a pipe that the child will write to
            2 => ['pipe', 'w']   // stderr is a pipe that the child will write to
        ];

        $this->pipes = [];
        $this->process = proc_open($this->command, $descriptorspec, $this->pipes, $this->cwd);

        if (!is_resource($this->process)) {
            $this->handleStartupErrors();
        }
    }

    public function handleStartupErrors() {
        if (!is_resource($this->process)) {
            throw new Exception("Failed to start process: " . $this->command);
        }
    }

    public function selectErrorStream() {
        return $this->pipes['stderr'];
    }

    public function readProcessErrors() {
        if (!is_resource($this->pipes['stderr'])) {
            return '';
        }

        $buffer = '';
        $fd = $this->pipes['stderr'];
        while (!feof($fd)) {
            $buffer .= fread($fd, 1024);
        }
        return $buffer;
    }

    public function writeProcessInput(string $string) {
        if (is_resource($this->pipes['stdin'])) {
            fwrite($this->pipes['stdin'], $string);
        }
    }
}

<?php
function get_git_tag_info($path) {
    // Check if .git directory exists
    if (!is_dir("$path/.git")) {
        return false;

    $command = "git -C $path describe --tags";

    // Execute command using pipes
    $process = proc_open($command, [
        0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
        1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
        2 => ['pipe', 'w']
    ], $pipes);

    if (!$process) {
        return false;

    // Read output and error streams

    $error = '';
    while (!feof($pipes[1])) {

    // Get exit code
    $exitCode = proc_close($process);

    // Check for errors
    if ($exitCode !== 0 || $error) {
        return false;
    }

    // Return trimmed output
    return trim($output);
}
?>

<?php
abstract class AbstractPhpProcess {
    protected $tempFile;
    protected $stdin;
    protected $env;
    protected $timeout;

    public function __construct($tempFile = null, $stdin = null, $env = [], $timeout = 0) {
        $this->tempFile = $tempFile;
        $this->stdin = $stdin;
        $this->env = $env;
        $this->timeout = $timeout;
    }

    abstract public function getHandles();
}

class DefaultPhpProcess extends AbstractPhpProcess {
    public function runJob($job, array $settings = []) {
        return $this->runProcess($job, $settings);
    }

    public function runProcess($job, array $settings) {
        $handles = $this->getHandles();
        $pipes = [];

        if (isset($handles['stdin'])) {
            $pipes['stdin'] = fopen($handles['stdin'], 'r');
        }

        if (isset($handles['stdout'])) {
            $pipes['stdout'] = fopen($handles['stdout'], 'w');
        }

        if (isset($handles['stderr'])) {
            $pipes['stderr'] = fopen($handles['stderr'], 'w');
        }

        $process = proc_open($job, $handles, $pipes);

        if (is_resource($process)) {
            $start_time = microtime(true);

            while (!feof($pipes['stdout']) && !feof($pipes['stderr'])) {
                if (microtime(true) - $start_time > $this->timeout) {
                    proc_terminate($process);
                    break;
                }
            }

            $output = '';
            $error = '';

            if (is_resource($pipes['stdout'])) {
                $output = fread($pipes['stdout'], 8192);
            }

            if (is_resource($pipes['stderr'])) {
                $error = fread($pipes['stderr'], 8192);
            }

            fclose($pipes['stdout']);
            fclose($pipes['stderr']);
            proc_close($process);

            return ['output' => $output, 'error' => $error];
        }

        return ['output' => '', 'error' => 'Failed to start process'];
    }

    public function process($pipe, $job) {
        if (is_resource($pipe)) {
            fwrite($pipe, $job . PHP_EOL);
        }
    }

    public function cleanup() {
        if ($this->tempFile) {
            unlink($this->tempFile);
        }
    }

    public function useTemporaryFile() {
        return false;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles inter-process communication (IPC) using proc_open to execute external commands, manage input/output streams, and handle errors.

Class Description: The ProcessHandler class manages subprocess execution via proc_open, providing methods to write input to the process, read output/errors, and properly clean up resources. It extends Monolog's AbstractProcessingHandler for logging integration.

Attributes:
- process: [resource|null] - The subprocess resource handle or null if not running
- command: [string] - The command to execute in the subprocess
- cwd: [string|null] - The working directory for the subprocess or null for default
- pipes: [array] - Array of file pointers for process pipes (stdin, stdout, stderr)

Methods:
- __construct(string $command, $level = Logger::DEBUG, bool $bubble = true, ?string $cwd = null) -> [void] - Initializes the handler with command and optional working directory
- write(array $record) -> [void] - Writes formatted log record to process stdin (inherited from AbstractProcessingHandler)
- close() -> [void] - Closes all pipes and terminates the process
- ensureProcessIsStarted() -> [void] - Starts the process if not already running
- startProcess() -> [void] - Executes proc_open to start the subprocess
- handleStartupErrors() -> [void] - Checks for and handles any startup errors
- selectErrorStream() -> [int|false] - Monitors stderr for error output
- readProcessErrors() -> [string] - Reads and returns content from stderr
- writeProcessInput(string $string) -> [void] - Writes data to process stdin
wrong_result:
<?php
use Monolog\Logger;
use Monolog\Handler\AbstractProcessingHandler;

class ProcessHandler extends AbstractProcessingHandler {
    protected $process;
    protected $command;
    protected $cwd;
    protected $pipes;

    public function __construct(string $command, $level = Logger::DEBUG, bool $bubble = true, ?string $cwd = null) {
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
        parent::__construct($level, $bubble);
    }

    public function write(array $record) {
        if ($this->process && is_resource($this->process)) {
            fwrite($this->pipes[0], $record['message'] . PHP_EOL);
        }
    }

    public function close() {
        if ($this->process && is_resource($this->process)) {
            fclose($this->pipes[0]);
            fclose($this->pipes[1]);
            fclose($this->pipes[2]);
            pclose($this->process);
            $this->process = null;
        }
    }

    public function ensureProcessIsStarted() {
        if (!isset($this->process) || !is_resource($this->process)) {
            $this->startProcess();
        }
    }

    protected function startProcess() {
        $descriptorspec = [
            0 => ['pipe', 'r'],  // stdin is a pipe to read from
            1 => ['pipe', 'w'],  // stdout is a pipe to write to
            2 => ['pipe', 'w']   // stderr is a pipe to write to
        ];

        $this->pipes = [];
        $this->process = proc_open($this->command, $descriptorspec, $this->pipes, $this->cwd);

        if (is_resource($this->process)) {
            $this->handleStartupErrors();
        } else {
            $this->error("Failed to start process: " . implode(" ", $this->command));
        }
    }

    protected function handleStartupErrors() {
        if (proc_get_status($this->process)['running'] === false) {
            $this->error("Process failed to start: " . implode(" ", $this->command));
        }
    }

    public function selectErrorStream() {
        return $this->pipes[2];
    }

    public function readProcessErrors() {
        if (is_resource($this->pipes[2])) {
            $output = '';
            while (!feof($this->pipes[2])) {
                $output .= fgets($this->pipes[2]);
            }
            return $output;
        }
        return '';
    }

    public function writeProcessInput(string $string) {
        if ($this->process && is_resource($this->process) && is_resource($this->pipes[0])) {
            fwrite($this->pipes[0], $string . PHP_EOL);
        }
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using Guzzle library to download files and fetch GitHub release information.

Class Description: The HttpClient class provides methods for downloading remote files via HTTP and retrieving GitHub release information (both stable and pre-release) using the Guzzle HTTP client library.

Attributes:
- client: [Client] - Guzzle HTTP client instance used for making requests

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the Guzzle HTTP client instance
- getSourceFile(string $fileName, string $savePath, string $url) -> [bool] - Downloads a file from the specified URL and saves it to the given path
- getLatestReleaseTagName(string $repo) -> [string] - Gets the latest stable release tag name from a GitHub repository
- getLatestPreReleaseTagName(string $repo) -> [string] - Gets the latest pre-release tag name from a GitHub repository

<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;

class HttpClient
{
    protected $client;

    public function __construct()
    {
        $this->client = new Client();
    }

    public function getSourceFile(string $fileName, string $savePath, string $url): bool
    {
        try {
            $response = $this->client->get($url, [
                'sink' => $savePath
            ]);

            if ($response->getStatusCode() === 200) {
                return true;
            }
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            // Handle exception
        }

        return false;
    }

    public function getLatestReleaseTagName(string $repo): string
    {
        $url = "https://api.github.com/repos/$repo/releases/latest";
        $response = $this->client->get($url);
        $data = json_decode($response->getBody(), true);

        if (isset($data['tag_name'])) {
            return $data['tag_name'];
        }

        return '';
    }

    public function getLatestPreReleaseTagName(string $repo): string
    {
        $url = "https://api.github.com/repos/$repo/releases/latest";
        $response = $this->client->get($url);
        $data = json_decode($response->getBody(), true);

        if (isset($data['prerelease']) && $data['prerelease']) {
            return $data['tag_name'];
        }

        return '';
    }
}

Task Description: Implement a Qiniu storage client class in PHP that handles HTTP requests to Qiniu's cloud storage service, including file uploads, downloads, and management operations.

Class Description: QiniuStorage is a client class for interacting with Qiniu's cloud storage service. It provides methods for making HTTP requests to Qiniu's API endpoints with proper headers and request handling.

Attributes:
- QINIU_RSF_HOST: string - Qiniu's RSF (Resource List) API host
- QINIU_RS_HOST: string - Qiniu's RS (Resource Management) API host  
- QINIU_UP_HOST: string - Qiniu's file upload API host
- timeout: string - Request timeout duration
- error: string - Last error message
- errorStr: string - Detailed error information

Methods:
- request(string $path, string $method, array|null $headers = null, mixed $body = null) -> mixed - Makes an HTTP request to Qiniu's API. Handles request setup, execution, and response processing.
- response(string $text) -> array - Processes the response text and extracts JSON data from headers.
- error(string $header, string $body) -> void - Handles error responses by parsing status codes and error messages.

Input Parameters for request():
- $path: string - The API endpoint path
- $method: string - HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, HEAD)
- $headers: array|null - Optional request headers
- $body: mixed - Request payload (can be string or resource)

Output for request():
- Returns response body for successful GET requests
- Returns parsed response array for other successful requests  
- Returns false on failure and sets error information

Input Parameters for response():
- $text: string - Raw response text with headers

Output for response():
- array - Parsed JSON data from response

Input Parameters for error():
- $header: string - Response header
- $body: string - Response body

Output for error():
- void - Sets error and errorStr properties

<?php
class QiniuStorage {
    public $QINIU_RSF_HOST = "rsf.api.qiniu.com";
    public $QINIU_RS_HOST = "rs.api.qiniu.com";
    public $QINIU_UP_HOST = "upload.qiniu.com";
    public $timeout = "30";
    public $error = "";
    public $errorStr = "";

    public function request($path, $method, array $headers = null, $body = null) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        $url = $this->QINIU_UP_HOST . $path;
        $headers = $headers ?: [];

        $headers[] = "Host: " . $this->QINIU_UP_HOST;
        $headers[] = "Connection: close";
        $headers[] = "Content-Type: application/octet-stream";

        if ($method === "POST" || $method === "PUT") {
            $headers[] = "Content-Length: " . strlen($body);
        }

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, (int)$this->timeout);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $method);

        if ($body !== null) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $body);
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $error = curl_error($ch);

        if ($error) {
            $this->error = "cURL error: " . $error;
            $this->errorStr = "cURL error: " . $error;
            return false;
        }

        if ($httpCode >= 400) {
            $this->error = "HTTP error: " . $httpCode;
            $this->errorStr = "HTTP error: " . $httpCode . " - " . $response;
            return false;
        }

        $result = $this->response($response);
        return $result;
    }

    public function response($text) {
        $json = json_decode($text, true);
        if (json_last_error() === JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            return $json;
        } else {
            $this->error = "JSON decode error";
            $this->errorStr = "JSON decode error: " . json_last_error_msg();
            return false;
        }
    }

    public function error($header, $body) {
        $this->error = $header;
        $this->errorStr = $body;
    }
}
